title: How to Create an FPS Creator Game

steps.headline: If you already own the software, you could set up rooms with segments, but if you have only just bought the game, select the prefab section
Pick a building that you want in game and click "OK"
Select the "Markers" tab just below the section where you clicked "Add New Prefab"
Select a "Player Start" and put it where you want the player to start (R is rotate)
Select a Win Zone and put it where you want the game to end
Select the "Entities" tab and click "Add new entity"
Go into either the "Items" under "Sci-Fi" or "WW2"
Pick a gun to fight with and put it on the floor in front of the player start (make sure it is in front of where the arrow is pointing).
Click "Add new entity" again and this time select "Characters" under "Sci-Fi" or "WW2" and pick your character for the game!
Put the character in the game
Push the green "Test Game" button and watch your game intelligently react.

text: Buy FPS Creator (see external links)  Install FPS Creator  If you already own the software, you could set up rooms with segments, but if you have only just bought the game, select the prefab section  Click "Add New Prefab"  Pick a building that you want in game and click "OK"  Select the "Markers" tab just below the section where you clicked "Add New Prefab"  Select a "Player Start" and put it where you want the player to start (R is rotate)  Select a Win Zone and put it where you want the game to end  Select the "Entities" tab and click "Add new entity"  Go into either the "Items" under "Sci-Fi" or "WW2"  Pick a gun to fight with and put it on the floor in front of the player start (make sure it is in front of where the arrow is pointing).  Click "Add new entity" again and this time select "Characters" under "Sci-Fi" or "WW2" and pick your character for the game!  Put the character in the game  Push the green "Test Game" button and watch your game intelligently react.
